description: From the German trademark Aspirin, from acetylierte Spirsäure (literally “acetylated spiraeic acid”). The trade name Aspirin is a registered trademark in some countries, but has entered the English language in generic usage.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, pharmacology) an analgesic drug, acetylsalicylic acid
examples: Coordinate terms: Tylenol/tylenol, paracetamol, acetaminophen, ibuprofen, codeine
